Operation 'homegraph.devices.query' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what is returned (QueryResponse format). Added explicit mention of return value and response structure to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's output.

data.current_description: Gets the current states in Home Graph for the given set of the third-party user's devices. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see QueryRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Get current device states from Home Graph
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current states in Home Graph for the specified third-party user's devices. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id` in the request. Returns a QueryResponse containing the state of each requested device. This operation must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what is returned (QueryResponse format). Added explicit mention of return value and response structure to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's output.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.reportStateAndNotification' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and lacks clarity about the response. Condensed description, clarified the error condition, and explicitly stated the return value type to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Reports device state and optionally sends device notifications. Called by your smart home Action when the state of a third-party device changes or you need to send a notification about the device. See [Implement Report State](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/integration/report-state) for more information. This method updates the device state according to its declared [traits](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/primer/device-types-and-traits). Publishing a new state value outside of these traits will result in an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error response. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see ReportStateAndNotificationRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Report device state changes and send notifications
data.description_suggestion: Reports device state changes and optionally sends device notifications to Home Graph. Called when a third-party device's state changes or when a notification must be sent. Updates device state according to declared traits; publishing state values outside declared traits results in an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error. Requires the third-party user's identity via `agent_user_id`. Returns a ReportStateAndNotificationResponse confirming the update. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and lacks clarity about the response. Condensed description, clarified the error condition, and explicitly stated the return value type to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.requestSync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the asynchronous nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of return value and clarified that the response is empty on success to help AI agents understand the operation's behavior.

data.current_description: Requests Google to send an `action.devices.SYNC` [intent](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/intents/sync) to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the given user. The third-party user's identity is passed via the `agent_user_id` (see RequestSyncDevicesRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Request device metadata synchronization for user
data.description_suggestion: Requests Google to send a SYNC intent to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the specified third-party user. Requires the user's identity via `agent_user_id`. Returns a RequestSyncDevicesResponse (empty on success). This operation triggers an asynchronous metadata refresh and must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the asynchronous nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of return value and clarified that the response is empty on success to help AI agents understand the operation's behavior.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and what information is returned. Added explicit mention of SyncResponse and the type of data returned (devices with metadata and traits) to improve AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Gets all the devices associated with the given third-party user. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see SyncRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all devices for third-party user
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all devices associated with the specified third-party user. Requires the user's identity via `agent_user_id` in the request. Returns a SyncResponse containing the complete list of devices with their metadata and traits. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and what information is returned. Added explicit mention of SyncResponse and the type of data returned (devices with metadata and traits) to improve AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'homegraph.agentUsers.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the irreversible nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of the Empty response, clarified the permanent nature of deletion, and noted the path parameter usage to improve AI agent understanding of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: Unlinks the given third-party user from your smart home Action. All data related to this user will be deleted. For more details on how users link their accounts, see [fulfillment and authentication](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/primer/fulfillment). The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see DeleteAgentUserRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Unlink and delete third-party user account
data.description_suggestion: Unlinks the specified third-party user from your smart home Action and permanently deletes all associated data. Requires the user's identity via `agentUserId` path parameter. Returns an Empty response on success. This operation is irreversible and must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the irreversible nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of the Empty response, clarified the permanent nature of deletion, and noted the path parameter usage to improve AI agent understanding of this destructive operation.

Added explicit mention of return value and clarified that the response is empty on success to help AI agents understand the operation's behavior.

data.current_description: Requests Google to send an `action.devices.SYNC` [intent](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/intents/sync) to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the given user. The third-party user's identity is passed via the `agent_user_id` (see RequestSyncDevicesRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Request device metadata synchronization for user
data.description_suggestion: Requests Google to send a SYNC intent to your smart home Action to update device metadata for the specified third-party user. Requires the user's identity via `agent_user_id`. Returns a RequestSyncDevicesResponse (empty on success). This operation triggers an asynchronous metadata refresh and must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the asynchronous nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of return value and clarified that the response is empty on success to help AI agents understand the operation's behavior.

message: Operation 'homegraph.devices.sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and what information is returned. Added explicit mention of SyncResponse and the type of data returned (devices with metadata and traits) to improve AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Gets all the devices associated with the given third-party user. The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see SyncRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all devices for third-party user
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all devices associated with the specified third-party user. Requires the user's identity via `agent_user_id` in the request. Returns a SyncResponse containing the complete list of devices with their metadata and traits. This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response structure and what information is returned. Added explicit mention of SyncResponse and the type of data returned (devices with metadata and traits) to improve AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'homegraph.agentUsers.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the irreversible nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of the Empty response, clarified the permanent nature of deletion, and noted the path parameter usage to improve AI agent understanding of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: Unlinks the given third-party user from your smart home Action. All data related to this user will be deleted. For more details on how users link their accounts, see [fulfillment and authentication](https://developers.home.google.com/cloud-to-cloud/primer/fulfillment). The third-party user's identity is passed in via the `agent_user_id` (see DeleteAgentUserRequest). This request must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.summary_suggestion: Unlink and delete third-party user account
data.description_suggestion: Unlinks the specified third-party user from your smart home Action and permanently deletes all associated data. Requires the user's identity via `agentUserId` path parameter. Returns an Empty response on success. This operation is irreversible and must be authorized using service account credentials from your Actions console project.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about the response and the irreversible nature of the operation. Added explicit mention of the Empty response, clarified the permanent nature of deletion, and noted the path parameter usage to improve AI agent understanding of this destructive operation.
